alerts.headline: winter storm warning in effect
alerts.description:
Winter storm continues.

What:
Total snowfall amounts of 20 to 40 cm. 
Peak snowfall rates of 3 to 5 cm per hour. 
Poor visibility in heavy snow and local blowing snow. 

When: 
Continuing tonight and tapering off Thursday morning. 

Additional information: 
Northerly winds gusting to 50 km/h will result in areas of blowing snow, further reducing visibility.

###

Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Visibility will be suddenly reduced to near zero at times in heavy snow and blowing snow. Poor weather conditions may contribute to transportation delays.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
alerts.instruction: Consider postponing non-essential travel until conditions improve.

Additional information:

###

Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Visibility will be suddenly reduced to near zero at times in heavy snow and blowing snow. Poor weather conditions may contribute to transportation delays.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.

alerts.headline: squall warning in effect
alerts.description:
Wind gusts to 50 knots have been reported over land associated with an area of convective showers moving northeast from Ohio. These squalls may affect the marine areas of Lake St. Clair and western Lake Erie, especially near the shore.

###

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
alerts.instruction: Mariners are advised to prepare for squalls. If underway, seek safe harbour immediately. Consider delaying or postponing travel in areas under the squall warning.

alerts.headline: winter storm warning in effect
alerts.description:
Winter storm continues.

What: 
Total snowfall amounts of 15 to 25 cm possible. 
Poor visibility in heavy snow and local blowing snow.

When: 
Tapering off this morning.

Additional information: 
Northerly winds gusting to 50 km/h will result in areas of blowing snow, further reducing visibility.

###

Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become difficult to navigate due to accumulating snow. Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become icy and slippery.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
alerts.instruction: Consider postponing non-essential travel until conditions improve.

affected_areas.area_description: Searchmont - Montreal River Harbour - Batchawana Bay
Sault Ste. Marie - St. Joseph Island

alerts.headline: wind warning in effect
alerts.description:
Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring.

An area of damaging wind gusts associated with a line of convective showers has been observed and may continue to push northeastward across portions of southwestern Ontario tonight.

Wind gusts to 90 km/h are possible.

###

Damage to buildings, such as to roof shingles and windows, may occur. Gusty winds can damage soft shelters, tents and awnings at outdoor events. Utility outages may occur.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.

alerts.headline: squall warning ended
alerts.description:
Squalls have weakened or moved out of the area.


###

alerts.headline: weather advisory ended
alerts.description:
The majority of the snowfall from this system has remained south of the Kapuskasing region.

###

alerts.headline: winter storm warning in effect
alerts.description:
Winter storm continues.

What: 
Total snowfall amounts of 20 to 40 cm possible for northern sections. 
Freezing rain with light ice build-up possible.

When: 
Tapering off this morning.

Additional information: 
Areas north of Elliot Lake are expected to see 20 to 40 cm of snow with the Elliot Lake area expected to see near 5 to 10 cm. A period of freezing rain for Elliot Lake is likely before the changeover to snow early this morning.

###

Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become difficult to navigate due to accumulating snow. Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become icy and slippery.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
alerts.instruction: Consider postponing non-essential travel until conditions improve. Prepare for quickly changing and deteriorating travel conditions.

alerts.headline: winter storm warning in effect
alerts.description:
Winter storm continues.

What: 
Total snowfall amounts of 20 to 40 cm possible. 
Freezing rain with light ice build-up possible.

When: 
Continuing through the morning. Tapering off this afternoon.

Additional information: 
Northern portions of the region will continue to see heavy snow through the morning. Southern portions of the region may experience a period of freezing rain before the changeover to snow early this morning.

###

Rapidly accumulating snow will make travel difficult. Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become icy and slippery.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
alerts.instruction: Consider postponing non-essential travel until conditions improve. Prepare for quickly changing and deteriorating travel conditions.

alerts.headline: freezing rain warning in effect
alerts.description:
Freezing rain is expected or occurring.

What:
Freezing rain with 2 to 5 mm of ice build-up possible.

When:
Continuing early this morning. Changing to snow later this morning.

Additional information:
After the changeover the snow across the region this morning, 5 cm accumulation may be possible before the snow tapers off late this morning or this afternoon.

This freezing rain warning replaces the winter storm warning that was previously in effect.

###

Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become icy and slippery.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
alerts.instruction: Slow down driving in slippery conditions. Watch for taillights ahead and maintain a safe following distance.

alerts.headline: rainfall warning ended
alerts.description:
Significant rainfall is no longer expected.


###

alerts.headline: wind warning ended
alerts.description:
Wind speeds are no longer expected to meet warning criteria.


###
